item.title: Application Development Top-Down
item.description: Typical management and technical mistake when developing web applications is building the system ground-up, from persistence level to web. The development usually starts from data modeling, persistence and service layers and, finally, the UI. The problem with ground-up approach is that Client can’t see and play with the product on early development stages. When a Client gets first working prototype a lot of work has been done both on front-end and back-end side.

item.title: Recommended Scrum Persentations
item.description:
For those, who not yet familiar with Scrum, I highly recommend to watch the «Scrum Training Series» presentations and the AgileMethodology.org website.

A Scrum Reference Card is also useful to understand what the Scrum is, it’s processes, roles and practices.

The presentations describes the Scrum process step by step.

item.title: Book: Good Old "Peopleware"
item.description: One more book worth reading - «Peopleware: Productive Projects and Teams» by Tom DeMarco and Timothy Lister. It’s essentially a Holy Bible for every manager!
